metadata.title: CVE-2017-5110 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate implementation of the web payments API on blob: and data:schemes in Web Payments in Google Chrome prior to 60.0.3112.78 for Mac,Windows, Linux, and Android allowed a remote attacker to spoof the contentsof the Omnibox via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5110` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.16.04.1293
chromium-browser-l10n - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.16.04.1293
chromium-chromedriver - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.16.04.1293
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.16.04.1293
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.16.04.1293
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.16.04.1293').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
